intro: Tetrastigma tonkinense, commonly known as the Vietnamese crossvine, is a climbing vine native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the grape family, Vitaceae, and is characterized by its vigorous growth and compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are followed by yellowish berries. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in humid forests and along riverbanks. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for horticultural and ecological studies.
